title: Interpret quartiles of amount spent on dinner

content.description: Data were collected on the amount, in dollars, that individual customers spent on dinner in an Italian restaurant. The quartiles for these data are given below.
content.question: Which of the following statements must be true for these customers?

choices.label: At least half of the customers spent less than or equal to $44.27 and at least half spent greater than or equal to $44.27.
Seventy-five percent of the customers spent between $36.27 and $58.97.
Twenty-five percent of the customers spent less than or equal to $58.97 and the remaining 75 percent spent greater than or equal to $58.97.
The mean amount spent by customers is $44.27.

content.answer: At least half of the customers spent less than or equal to $44.27 and at least half spent greater than or equal to $44.27.

topic.text: 1.7: Summary Statistics for a Quantitative Variable

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Calculate summary statistics, relative positions of points within a distribution, correlation, and predicted response.
